results.content:
I started this course with an extremely limited knowledge (next to none) of HTML and CSS and no knowledge whatsoever of Bootstrap (I didn't even really know what it was).

Nick manages to take you from that level up to the stage of feeling confident and capable of creating websites from scratch.

His teaching style is thoroughly engaging and the videos are put together much more professionally than the vast majority of courses that are available. It seems like a lot of thought, planning and care have been put into making the course, both in terms of its content and delivery.

I cannot recommend this course highly enough to people in a similar situation to that which I was prior to this course. You will enjoy yourself, be surprised at your progress and finish off with some very decent skills and a great grounding to move forward. Nick is an inspirational tutor and so moving forward and learning more is exactly what you will want to do upon completing the course.

The only negative comment I have to make is that I'm not sure what benefit the few lectures early in the course that are delivered by Nick's co-creator, Phil, add to the course. I'm of the opinion that the course would lose nothing if they were removed and would probably be better without them. I'm sure Phil delivers great courses in his own right so this is not meant as a slight on him or his style, I just don't think there is any real value to the specific lectures he delivers in this course. The good news is that there aren't many of them so don't let that put you off this course. The only reason I mentioned it at all is for the sake of balance to this review.

To reiterate, the course is amazing and if you are looking for a beginners course on these subjects you will not find a better one than this. Get it!

results.content: Please note the 5 stars! Now, I must have misunderstood the overview for this course. I have a good amount of HTML and CSS experience, but I wanted to take something for a refresher because its been awhile. I also thought there would be things I didn't know. This course is a very basic level. Really basic. This course probably isn't for anyone that has done any HTML on their own before. I would convert this class into an in-depth Bootstrap course because thats where people will learn. Nick always makes learning fun, and this course is no different. So if you are a COMPLETE beginner this course will be a fine place to start, but don't think you are going to expand any current knowledge, again, I am not knocking the course, just trying to help people understand what they are buying.

Besides that, I think it would have been nice to include some links to other cool things you can do, for example, sticky navbars, things that change when you scroll, etc. I don't mean to explain them, just point out from their experience, where we could find some cool codes that do amazing things, besides those covered here. In any case, excellent course, definitely would recommend.

results.content: With the exception of the Bootstrap content, I for the most part, already had a handle on the content.  I enjoyed the course and thought that it was really good for beginners.  I thought that the early jumps to content about Wordpress was really jarring potentially for beginners, and as the course got toward the end, the speed at which information was provided definitely got to the point where I think beginners would get lost a bit. For those students who are willing to do their fair share of web searching, this course is a good start.  For those who are expecting every bit of knowledge about basic HTML/CSS to be handed to them, then perhaps this course might be a bit lacking.

results.content:
I already have some experience with HTML and CSS, so I was expecting to learn more complicated or new stuff in this course since the course title says specifically HTML5 and CSS3.   The initial HTML and CSS sections are extremely basic  so I wound up speeding through  all the sections since I already knew those parts.

I bought this course because I had a specific problem aligning text over an image in my hero image (yes, I Googled the problem and could not find the right answer) so I thought I needed to learn CSS better.   Now, with Bootstrap, I know a better way how to handle it!

Good news: Bootstrap will actually make it much faster and easier to build a site, so I'm very happy about that.  This course did a good job teaching Bootstrap. 

However, the real-world examples by the other teacher were all using WordPress, so that wasn't very helpful when I'm building a site in HTML and CSS.

I got used to you as if I knew you personally, and now it's a little hard for me to get to the end.
The course was great, I learned a lot of things. Since I’m working, I’ve been working 2-3h on this every day, and I’ve learned a lot in these one month. From a complete beginner who had no idea about making sites, I can now make a real site. Of course, I still have a lot to learn, but I am very pleased with how much I have progressed in a very short time.
I want to thank you both from the bottom of my heart. I wish you all the best!
I would recommend this course to anyone who is a complete beginner, you will learn a lot.
I am very very satisfied !!!!

results.content:
Let me start by saying Nick (or Rick) is a fantastic instructor!  He explains things clearly, his enthusiasm kept my interest throughout the course, and he is a genuinely nice guy.  I did, however, feel he rushed the course a bit when he started the Bootstrap section.  I realize it’s not possible to cover every aspect of Bootstrap, but (in my humble opinion); more time should have been devoted to that area.

In addition, because I am an absolute beginner, I have discovered my personal preference to Bootstrap is FlexboxGrid.   I’m certain Nick had a reason for choosing Bootstrap, but during my extremely limited time experimenting with both, I feel FlexboxGrid is easier to use.  In either case, Nick taught me the value of experimenting with new things.  Thus, finding and trying FlexboxGrid is a direct result of Nick’s training.

Thanks Nick, for all of your hard work!  Great course!!
